Caradoc now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: Levna has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of her allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Protection
reaction.text: When a creature Levna can see within 5 feet of her is targeted by an attack, she can impose disadvantage on the attack roll if she can see the attacker and she is wielding a melee weapon.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 212

monster.name: Lohezet

trait.name: Toxic Mastery
trait.text: Lohezet ignores a creature's resistance to poison damage.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Lohezet casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):
• At will: detect magic, light, prestidigitation • 2/Day each: dimension door, mage armor • 1/Day each: arcane eye, dominate person, wall of force

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Lohezet makes three Withering Blast attacks and uses Miasma if it's available. He can replace one of the attacks with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Withering Blast
action.text: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d12 + 5) necrotic damage.

action.name: Miasma (Recharge 4-6)
action.text: Lohezet magically conjures a billowing cloud of purple fog in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within 120 feet of himself. The area within the sphere is heavily obscured, and when a creature starts its turn in the sphere or enters the sphere for the first time on a turn, it must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 39 (6d12) poison damage and is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't poisoned. The cloud lasts for 1 minute, until Lohezet ends it early (no action required), or until Lohezet uses this action again. A strong wind disperses the cloud.

reaction.name: Noxious Rebuke (3/Day)
reaction.text: When a creature within 60 feet of Lohezet damages him, Lohezet magically retaliates with a spray of foul, purple mist. The creature must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (2d10 + 5) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.spells: detect magic, light, prestidigitation, dimension door, mage armor, arcane eye, dominate person, wall of force
monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 205

monster.name: Lord Soth

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If Soth fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Soth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
trait.text: Unless Soth is incapacitated, he and Undead creatures of his choice within 60 feet of him are immune to features that turn Undead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: Soth doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Soth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):
• At will: command (cast at 3rd level) • 1/Day: banishment (cast at 6th level) • 2/Day each: dispel magic, hold person (cast at 3rd level)

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Soth makes three Forsaken Brand attacks.

action.name: Forsaken Brand
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of Soth's next turn.

action.name: Cataclysmic Fire (1/Day)
action.text: Soth hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point he can see within 120 feet of himself. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 35 (10d6) fire damage and 35 (10d6) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, any Medium or smaller Humanoid killed by this damage, as well as every corpse of such a creature within the sphere, becomes a skeleton (see the Monster Manual) under Soth's control. The skeleton acts on Soth's initiative but immediately after his turn. Absent any other command, the skeleton tries to kill any non-Undead creature it encounters.

action.name: Word of Death (1/Day)
action.text: Soth points at a creature he can see within 60 feet of himself and magically commands it to die. The target must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw, taking 100 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target dies.

legendary.name: Legendary Actions (3/Turn)
legendary.text: Lord Soth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Lord Soth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Implacable Maneuver
legendary.text: Soth moves up to his speed or commands a mount he is riding to move up to its speed. The movement from this action doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. If he or his mount moves within 5 feet of a creature during this movement, he can force the creature to make a DC 20 Strength saving throw. The creature is knocked prone unless it succeeds on the saving throw.

legendary.name: Strike (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: Soth makes one Forsaken Brand attack.

monster.spells: command, banishment, dispel magic, hold person
monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 206

monster.name: Red Ruin

trait.name: Draconic Devotion
trait.text: While Red Ruin can see a Dragon that isn't hostile to her, she has advantage on attack rolls.

trait.name: Mounted Combat Master
trait.text: When Red Ruin is mounted and a creature targets her mount with an attack, Red Ruin can cause the attack to target her instead.

trait.name: Mounted Evasion
trait.text: When Red Ruin or her mount makes a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage from an effect, they take no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Red Ruin makes three Ember Lance attacks.

action.name: Ember Lance
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or fall prone.

action.name: Explosive Hand Crossbow (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Red Ruin fires an explosive crossbow bolt at a point she can see within 120 feet of herself. When the bolt reaches that point, or if it hits an object early, it detonates in a 20-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (10d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 208

monster.name: Sea Elf Scout

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The scout has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: The scout has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put it to sleep.

trait.name: Child of the Sea
trait.text: The scout can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The scout makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, ranged 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 114

monster.name: Sivak Draconian

trait.name: Death Throes
trait.text: When the draconian is reduced to 0 hit points by a creature that is Large or smaller, the draconian crumbles into dust that then forms a spectral, shrieking image of the creature that killed it. The image lasts for 1 minute. Each creature hostile to the draconian within 10 feet of the image must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of the spectral image for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The draconian makes two Serrated Sword attacks and one Tail attack.

action.name: Serrated Sword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

reaction.name: Shape Theft
reaction.text: After the draconian kills a Medium or smaller Humanoid, the draconian magically cloaks itself in an illusion to look and feel like that creature while retaining the draconian's game statistics (other than its size). This transformation lasts until the draconian dies or uses a bonus action to end it.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 199

monster.name: Skeletal Knight
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces the skeletal knight to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is bludgeoning or from a critical hit. On a success, the skeletal knight drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: The skeletal knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The skeletal knight makes three Enervating Blade or Throwing Axe attacks in any combination.

action.name: Enervating Blade
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) necrotic damage, and if the target is a creature, it can't regain hit points until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

action.name: Throwing Axe
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 208

monster.name: Tem Temble
monster.skill: Insight +4, Stealth +4, Sleight Of Hand +4, Medicine +4, Perception +4

trait.name: Bonus Proficiencies
trait.text: Tem is proficient with simple weapons and light armor.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Tem's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 to spell attacks). She has the following druid spells prepared:
• At will: druidcraft, poison spray • 1st level (2 slots): healing word

action.name: Hoopak
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, or 4 (1d4 + 2) bludgeoning damage if Tem used the hoopak's sling to make a ranged attack.

action.name: Taunt
action.text: Tem launches an infuriating barrage of insults at a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. If the target can hear Tem, it must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Elusive (Bonus Action)
action.text: Tem takes the Disengage or Hide action.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 212

monster.name: Virruza

trait.name: Death Throes
trait.text: When Virruza is reduced to 0 hit points, he turns into a puddle of acid and splashes acid on those around him. Each creature within 5 feet of him must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be covered in acid for 1 minute. A creature can use its action to scrape or wash the acid off itself or another creature. A creature covered in the acid takes 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: Virruza has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: Virruza regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text:
Virruza's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). Virruza can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
• At will: detect magic, detect thoughts, mage hand • 1/Day: fireball • 2/Day each: fear, invisibility (self only)

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Virruza makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws or staff. Alternatively, he uses his Hurl Flame twice.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Staff
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +4 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) fire damage. The fire ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

monster.spells: detect magic, detect thoughts, mage hand, fireball, fear, invisibility
monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 119

monster.name: Wasteland Dragonnel
monster.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak

trait.name: Flyby
trait.text: The dragonnel doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragonnel makes two Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Spit
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) acid damage.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 201

monster.name: Wersten Kern

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
trait.text: If damage reduces Wersten to 0 hit points, she must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is bludgeoning or from a critical hit. On a success, Wersten drops to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
trait.text: Wersten doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text:
Wersten casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16):
• 1/Day each: dispel magic, wall of stone

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: Wersten makes three Banner Pike attacks and uses Terrifying Litany if it's available.

action.name: Banner Pike
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be cursed. The curse lasts until it is lifted by remove curse or similar magic. Black, thorny rose stems sprout from the creature's body while it is cursed, imposing disadvantage on the creature's ability checks and attack rolls and halving its speed. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw against the curse is immune to it for 24 hours.

action.name: Terrifying Litany (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: Wersten recites names of souls slain by Soth and his company, channeling their mortal terror. Each creature that isn't an Undead within 30 feet of her must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 22 (4d10) psychic damage and is frightened of Wersten for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't frightened. At the end of each of its turns, a frightened creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.description: Source: Dragonlance: Shadow of the Dragon Queen p. 209
